name: Hilton Duesseldorf

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel as it was close to our office.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Short cab ride from the airport, short cab ride to socialise with my colleagues.
reviews.title: Clean & Modern Business Hotel

reviews.text: Lovely staff, wonderful facilities. Does what it said on the tin!
reviews.title: Not the best Hilton but convenient

reviews.text: Really nice breakfast, clean, comfortable and fab rooms.
reviews.title: Good Hilton close to Messe Center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights on business. Location was great as only for me, a 10 moniute walk to the office but I think for a leisure break a bit too far out of the centre of Dusseldorf. Used the S Bahn to get into the centre which including the walk to the stop took about 30 mins, though taxi does it in about 10 mins for about 10 EUR. hotel breakfast very good and with a friendly service. The rooms are very nice, quite spacious. The only downside is the wireless cost at 22 EUR per day. It's 2012. Wireless should be included in all room rates. You could get for 9 EUR though for a smart phone !!!! Barthrooms nice with some nice toiletries provided. Shower also good with good temperature too. Would give 5 stars if wireless cost was free or much lower, but it's a 4 star rating for now.
reviews.title: Another great stay

reviews.text: My colleagues and I have stayed in this hotel for 2 nights during a business visit to QVC distribution center not far from Dusseldorf.
reviews.title: Good hotel for a short businesstrip

reviews.text: I liked the hotel, nice bar, nice rooms, magnificent breakfast.
reviews.title: ok for layover...basic hilton...good cafe

reviews.text: The only disappointment was the absence of free wifi anywhere. They have paid wifi, but paying more euros for one day of internet than I pay for the whole month at home made me feel sick )
reviews.title: Comfortable business trip

reviews.text: stayed one night for layover...basic clean room with bed and bath ok...lobby and halls had dirty wet carpet (unexpected uncleanliness compared to german stds); cafe with good buffet with german eats and beer selection; included shuttle had driver who was very rude and rough with luggage; safe hotel for overnight...not really longterm stayplace
reviews.title: Satisfied experience (considering it's a Hilton)

reviews.text: Stayed at this Hilton on business for 4 nights. Location is close to the airport and a short taxi ride into the city centre and train station. There is also a tram stop into the main station very near the hotel.
reviews.title: Depends on rate
Dusseldorf Hilton is back alive!
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hilton Dusseldorf for three nights and I it was very good! They've put a lot of effort in the renovation of the hotel, and it has paid off!

reviews.title: Not Up to the Standard
reviews.text: Great staff, great service, great breakfast and bar.

It is pretty safe to say that all of the Hilton hotels in Germany share the same high quality. The Hilton Düsseldorf is a very comfortable hotel in a quiet, dignified section of Düsseldorf with easy access to the rest of the city and a short walk to a lovely park on the Rhine river.
reviews.title: Typical Hilton Germany quality

reviews.text: My room is comfortable and the much needed air conditioning works perfectly, although the blower is a little noisy. The bed is of good standard and the room is very spacious. There is a minibar (unfortunately the Hilton automatic billing kind) and coffee making facilities. My bathroom is a little cramped, but the shower works fine. Food and drinks are of course very expensive, as are the minibar choices, but there are a few restaurants in the general area. The closest public transport is a light rail about 300-400 meters from the hotel. If you drive to the hotel, there is paid parking on site.
reviews.title: Truly a Hilton

reviews.text: While I wish that the European Hiltons didn’t try to nickel and dime you so much, they make up for it with the comfortable rooms. I’ve never been able to match the sleep quality that I get at these hotels at the non-corporate hotels. Here, I don’t need to wonder if I’m going to hear drunks crashing through the streets at 3 AM screaming bloody murder, and I don’t need to toss and turn in bed because the air conditioning is either non-existent or just pitiful and it is just too hot to sleep. I’d stay here again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Comfortable and friendly
Nice hotel. Between airport and city
reviews.text: Very tastefully decorated hotel, in all areas. The room was spotless, spacious, practical and very comfortable. The staff went out of their way to help us and were very friendly, informatiive and professional. The location has excellent public transport links, albeit a few minutes walk. I cannot find fault in this hotel and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. I will gladly stay here again.

Usually big chain hotels can seem unfriendly but I always feel at home staying at the Hilton Duesseldorf. Members of staff are friendly and helpful, rooms are comfortable, clean and quiet. The executive lounge is always well stocked with delicious food and drink and pleasant staff. You can borrow a bicycle from the hotel to go into town, the bike paths are so well organised and you can ride through the lovely park alongside the Rhine. It is also very close to the Messe Dusseldorf, which can be reached by taxi or tram. I would recommend this hotel for business and pleasure alike.
reviews.title: Comfortable as alternative to airport staying
Very comfortable and efficient
reviews.text: Was a little concerned about the location having read prior reviews, but need not have worried. It was only a 5 minute cab ride for 13 euro's to get from the airport to the hotel. And taking the tram/train into the city could not have been easier. A short 5 minute walk from the hotel at most, then only 5 stops on the tram/ train that runs about every 5 minutes, and you are in the middle of the city in the Old Town. The hotel itself was very efficient, and clean. Breakfast was a buffet and was very good. The executive lounge on the 11th floor was good with light snacks in the evening. The room we had was spacious, with a good desk, and the room was very welcoming. The staff we met were all very pleasant and helpful. Would have no hesitation recommending this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This review really confirms what has recently been reported – a very nice hotel with exceptionally friendly and helpful staff, refurbished rooms with small but clean bathrooms, in a quiet location some way out of town and clearly orientated toward business.
reviews.title: A good base for a visit

reviews.text: However that does not mean that the leisure visitor are overlooked or precluded. The restaurant, in our experience, provided a good selection of freshly cooked and reasonably priced food in an airy atmosphere and the breakfast was Hilton! Using public transport, access is simply not a problem as this is frequent and reliable. With the Dusseldorf Welcome card (unfortunately not available at the hotel but can be pre-purchased online) transport and other visits are a bargain. For the more energetic there are the free cycles.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel deserves its five stars.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in north Duesseldorf, if you want to go into the old town, you need a cab.

reviews.text: I am still waiting to see exciting or impressive Hilton hotel. Not that there is anything wrong with this one but nothing special. Negatives - soft bed but didnt like the flat soft pillows, the hot water in shower fluctuated, 22 eur for 24 hrs internet!! I liked the big bathtub and the nice toiletries. Also the breakfast was good.
reviews.title: Great value, convenient for airport and U-bahn

description: Enjoy a central location at the Hilton Dusseldorf hotel, just 10 minutes from Dusseldorf city center and Dusseldorf International Airport. Walk three minutes from the hotel and take a two-mile tram ride into downtown Dusseldorf. This Dusseldorf hotel is five minutes from Dusseldorf Fairground and conference center. Headquarters of L´Oreal, Vodafone and IBM are within walking distance.Select from 375 comfortable guest rooms and suites to unwind after a busy day in Dusseldorf.
